text: The Brit Award for British Urban Act was an award given by the British Phonographic Industry (BPI), an organisation which represents record companies and artists in the United Kingdom. The accolade is presented at the Brit Awards, an annual celebration of British and international music. The winners and nominees are determined by the Brit Awards voting academy with over one- thousand members, which comprise record labels, publishers, managers, agents, media, and previous winners and nominees. The award was first presented in 2003 and was last presented in 2006. ==Winners and nominees== Inaugural winner Ms. Dynamite 2005 winner Joss Stone {| class="wikitable sortable" !
